question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find the real roots of
\[(x - 7)(x - 3)(x + 1)(x + 5) = 1680.\]
inference:
**Solution:**
\begin{align*}
(x - 7)(x - 3)(x + 1)(x + 5) &= 1680\\
(x^2 - 10x + 21)(x^2 + 4x - 5) &= 1680\\
x^4 - 6x^3 - 42x^2 + 84x - 105 &= 1680\\
x^4 - 6x^3 - 42x^2 + 84x - 1785 &= 0\\
(x^2 - 15)(x^2 + 1) &= 0\\
x^2 - 15 &= 0 \quad \text{or} \quad x^2 + 1 = 0\\
x^2 &= 15 \quad \text{or} \quad x^2 = -1\\
x &= \pm \sqrt{15} \quad \text{or} \quad x = \pm i\\
\end{align*}
**Final Answer: \\boxed{$\pm \sqrt{15}, \pm i$}. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth:
Note that $(x - 7)(x + 5) = x^2 - 2x - 35$ and $(x - 3)(x + 1) = x^2 - 2x - 3,$ so
\[(x^2 - 2x - 35)(x^2 - 2x - 3) = 1680.\]Let $y = x^2 - 2x - 19,$ so
\[(y - 16)(y + 16) = 1680.\]Then $y^2 - 256 = 1680,$ so $y^2 = 1936.$  Hence, $y = \pm 44.$

If $y = 44,$ then $x^2 - 2x - 19 = 44,$ or $x^2 - 2x - 63 = 0.$  The roots are $x = 9$ and $x = -7.$

If $y = -44$, then $x^2 - 2x - 19 = -44,$ or $x^2 - 2x + 25 = 0.$  This quadratic has no real roots.

Thus, the real roots are $\boxed{9,-7}.$

If $y = 44,$ then $x^2 - 2x - 19 = 44,$ or $x^2 - 2x - 63 = 0.$  The roots are $x = 9$ and $x = -7.$

If $y = -44$, then $x^2 - 2x - 19 = -44,$ or $x^2 - 2x + 25 = 0.$  This quadratic has no real roots.
